meanings.definition: A small, sharp pointed outgrowth on the skin or plant
meanings.sent1: The cactus had a sharp prickle that could hurt if touched.
meanings.sent2: I carefully avoided the prickle on the rose stem.
meanings.sent3: The hedgehog's prickles made it look like a tiny porcupine.
meanings.sent4: The prickle on the thorn bush caught my sleeve as I passed by.
meanings.sent5: The prickle on the caterpillar's back served as its defense mechanism.

meanings.definition: To cause a tingling or stinging sensation
meanings.sent1: The cold wind made my skin prickle with goosebumps.
meanings.sent2: The thought of the upcoming exam made me prickle with anxiety.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment made her skin prickle with happiness.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the haunted house made my senses prickle with fear.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the roller coaster ride made my whole body prickle with excitement.

meanings.definition: To feel a sensation like pricking
meanings.sent1: As I sat on the grass, I felt my skin prickle from the tiny bugs crawling on me.
meanings.sent2: The new fabric of the shirt made my skin prickle uncomfortably.
meanings.sent3: The spooky story made my imagination prickle with fear.
meanings.sent4: The suspenseful movie made my nerves prickle with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The icy water made my skin prickle with cold.

meanings.definition: To cover or be covered with prickles
meanings.sent1: The bushes in the garden prickle my hands when I try to trim them.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fur prickle against my skin when I pet it the wrong way.
meanings.sent3: The rough surface of the fruit prickle my fingers as I peel it.
meanings.sent4: The thorny vines prickle the legs of anyone who walks through the overgrown area.
meanings.sent5: The dry grass in the field prickle my feet as I walk barefoot.
